pageContext.title: In brief: Aussie education startup gets $3m from Pangaea, others
pageContext.content:
Australia-based Academy Xi has raised US$3 million in series B funding, led by Pangaea Impact Investments, Alium Capital, and Giant Leap Fund. Unnamed Singaporean investors also participated.

Source: SmartCompany

Academy Xi will use the fresh capital to grow its online product offering and extend corporate partnership. The platform conducts online courses in design and new technologies, such as blockchain, mixed reality, and user experience.

It will also be used to support the company’s expansion into Singapore next year, although the move seems to have been delayed. Co-founder Ben Wong previously said that his team was planning to enter Singapore this year.

seo.title: In brief: Academy Xi bags $3m from Pangaea, others
seo.description: With the money, Academy Xi aims to push through with its planned Singapore expansion.
